intro: Sebastiania howardiana, commonly known as the Howard's sebastiania, is a species of flowering plant in the family Euphorbiaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of Central and South America, particularly in countries like Costa Rica and Panama. The plant is characterized by its striking, palmate leaves and clusters of yellow-orange flowers that bloom throughout the year. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland forests. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
